orbkit
  • Docs »
  • Documentation
  • View page source

DocumentationÂ¶

This documentation should serve as an overview of how to operate orbkit.

First, we describe how to prepare inputs from several quantum chemistry programs (Requirements for the Input Files). Then, we show how to use orbkit as standalone program in the Terminal (Usage via the Terminal).

Subsequently, we show how to use those functionalities in your Python programs with orbkit’s orbkit’s High-Level Interface. You can also use orbkit’s functions directly in your Python programs. This is shown in orbkit’s Low-Level Interface.

Besides computing quantities using arbitrary grids, orbkit is also able to compute analytical integrals between atomic and molecular orbitals. Thus, you can use orbkit to compute expectation values analytically. The basics are described in Analytical Integrals with orbkit.

Finally, we provide some chapters on orbkit’s Central Variables and Options. The chapter Function Reference contains the docstrings of all functions in orbkit.

Hint

Please refer to Tutorials for practical applications.
